delete.title: Delete a Gateway Service
delete.description: Deleting this Gateway Service will also remove any associated routes and plugins. This action cannot be reversed.

placeholder.kongManager: Filter by exact name or ID

empty_state.title: Configure a New Gateway Service
empty_state.description: Gateway services are used to proxy traffic.

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information will help identify and manage this Gateway Service.

keys.title: Service Endpoint
keys.description: Define the endpoint for this service by specifying the full URL or by its separate elements.
keys.checkedGroupLabel: Choose how and where to send traffic

upstream_url.label: Upstream URL
upstream_url.tooltip_for_konnect: This is the URL of the API you will manage in Konnect.
upstream_url.tooltip_for_km: This is the URL of the API you will manage in Kong Gateway.

protocol.label: Protocol
protocol.tooltip: The protocol used to communicate with the upstream.

host.label: Host
host.tooltip: The host of the upstream server. Note that the host value is case sensitive.

path.label: Path
path.tooltip: The path to be used in request to the upstream server.

retries.label: Retries
retries.tooltip: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy.

connect_timeout.label: Connection Timeout
connect_timeout.tooltip: The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection to the upstream server.

write_timeout.label: Write Timeout
write_timeout.tooltip: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive write operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server.

read_timeout.label: Read Timeout
read_timeout.tooltip: The timeout in milliseconds between two successive read operations for transmitting a request to the upstream server.

client_certificate.label: Client Certificate
client_certificate.tooltip: Certificate to be used as client certificate while TLS handshaking to the upstream server.

ca_certificates.label: CA Certificates
ca_certificates.placeholder: Enter a comma separated list of CA Certificate IDs
ca_certificates.tooltip: Array of {code1} object UUIDs that are used to build the trust store while verifying upstream server's TLS certificate. If set to {code2} when Nginx default is respected. If default CA list in Nginx are not specified and TLS verification is enabled, then handshake with upstream server will always fail (because no CA are trusted).

tls_verify_enabled.label: TLS Verify
tls_verify_enabled.help: If unchecked, use default system setting
tls_verify_enabled.tooltip: Whether to enable verification of upstream server TLS certificate. If set to {code1}, then the Nginx default is respected.

tags.label: Tags
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings associated with the Service for grouping and filtering.
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.tooltip: Whether the Service is active. If set to {false}, the proxy behavior will be as if any routes attached to it do not exist (404). Default: {true}.

errors.general: Gateway Services could not be retrieved
errors.delete: The gateway service could not be deleted at this time.
errors.validationNameError: The name can be any string containing letters, numbers, or the following characters: ., -, _, or ~. Do not use spaces.
